cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 165 miles SE of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across central-western Cuba today, then into the southeastern Gulf and northward along the west coast of Florida toward the Big Bend area
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida west coast near the Tampa Bay–Cedar Key area

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch – Florida Keys from east of Craig Key to Ocean Reef, Florida Bay, and west coast of Florida from Englewood to the Aucilla River
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning – Florida Keys from Craig Key to Dry Tortugas and west coast of Florida from Flamingo to Englewood; Hurricane/Tropical-storm warnings for several Cuban provinces
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys and the entire west coast of Florida, especially from Flamingo northward to the Big Bend
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤12%) chance of tropical-storm-force gusts; brief squalls possible Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the southeast Florida coast
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain possible Tuesday–Wednesday could cause localized street or terminal flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado risk Tuesday associated with outer rain bands
